FuncDef:
The traffic-policy match-ip-layer command configures MF traffic classification based only on IP Layer (Layer 3) information for outgoing or incoming traffic on the public network.
The undo traffic-policy match-ip-layer command restores the default settings.
By default, MF traffic classification is implemented based on Layer 2 and MPLS Layer information for outgoing or incoming traffic on the public network.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the outgoing traffic on the public network.
-

Indicates the incoming traffic on the public network.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The traffic-policy match-ip-layer mpls-pop command configures MF traffic classification based on IP Layer information for outgoing traffic on the public network.
The traffic-policy match-ip-layer mpls-push command configures MF traffic classification based on IP Layer information for incoming traffic on the public network.
The undo traffic-policy match-ip-layer mpls-pop command configures MF traffic classification based on Layer 2 and MPLS Layer information for outgoing traffic on the public network.
The undo traffic-policy match-ip-layer mpls-push command configures MF traffic classification based on Layer 2 and MPLS Layer information for incoming traffic on the public network.
Precautions
The traffic-policy match-ip-layer command takes effect for the entire board. Before running the traffic-policy match-ip-layer or undo traffic-policy match-ip-layer command, ensure the configurations on all interfaces are correct.
This command can be used only on the PE device
